original_title: Sri Lanka President discusses economy with CB Governor, Treasury secy
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s newly elected President Anura Dissanayake had met Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe and Treasury Secretary Mahinda Siriwardana, a government statement said.
Mahinda Siriwardana was re-appointed as Treasury Secretary earlier on Tuesday.
The current status of the economy, measures to stabilize the economy was discussed at length, the statement said.

Sri Lanka is emerging from sovereign default, achieved without a war, after four back to back currency crises coming in the wake of aggressive, inflationary open market operations to target the average call money rate claiming that historical 12-month inflation was low (flexible inflation targeting).
At each currency crises from mis-targeted call money rate, the exchange rate was depreciated before or concurrently with sudden corrections in  interest rates triggering social and political unrest.
Sri Lanka borrowed heavily abroad in peacetime as foreign shortages emerged from the inflationary open market operations to reach potential output.

The International Monetary Fund gave technical assistance to calculate potential output, giving an incentive for the central bank, which had created forex shortages for 72 years, to print money to close a so-called ‘output gap’.
After each currency crisis, as output collapsed the ‘potential output’s also got smaller.
Before the restructure from the first currency was over the IMF issued another technical assistance report to start a single policy rate. (Colombo/Aug24/2024)
